intro: Sida hibisciformis, commonly known as the silky sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas. Sida hibisciformis is used in traditional medicine and for its fibrous material.
